1.str2: To pass by, depart, pass away. From para and ago; to lead near, i.e. to go along or away.

1.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Birth. Feminine of a presumed derivative of the base of genea; birth.

(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

34.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
34.str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.

34.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
34.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

34.str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

34.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.

34.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

36.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

36.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
